clinical_study.brief_title: fMRI Feasibility Older Hip Fracture Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Functional MRI in Older People Following Hip Fracture Surgery: a Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: An assessment of the feasibility of structural and functional magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) brain scans in older people who have recovered from and older people who never had delirium after hip fracture surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Postoperative delirium, an acute sate of confusion occurs with higher frequency in older people. Hip fracture surgery is a procedure associated with an increased risk of postoperative delirium.
In the study the feasibility of achieving structure and functional connectivity imaging of the brain, using magnetic resonance imaging, in older people who are recovering from hip fracture surgery will be assessed.
People who have recovered from post operative delirium and people who did not have postoperative delirium will be included.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of MRI in older people following hip fracture surgery assessed by tolerability of transfer to scanner and the scanning process
primary_outcome.time_frame: From time of consent to day after MRI scan which is up to 5 days
primary_outcome.description: The feasibility of transferring participants to and achieving structural and functional MRI scans. Specifically we will assess the number of participants in whom scans were successfully achieved

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to one month after scans have been achieved
secondary_outcome.description: Identify any differences in functional connectivity between the resolved delirium and the never delirium MRI scans

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From immediately prior to transfer to the MRI suite until return to own hospital bed which is approximately 2 hours
secondary_outcome.description: An assessment of baseline pain levels and then repeat assessments of pain during transfer and the MRI scanning process using the numerical pain rating scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Actual times taken to achieve scans
secondary_outcome.description: An assessment of unforeseen constraints on time taken to scan

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two occassions. The first immediately after return from the MRI scan suite. The second will occur the day after scanning. Each will take 5 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: The participant experience will be explored via verbal feedback which will be documented by the accompanying researcher

arm_group.description: Older people recovering from hip fracture surgery who did not have postoperative delirium
Older people recovering from hip fracture surgery who experienced delirium which has resolved

intervention.description: Series of MRI scans of the brain

study_pop.textblock: Older people recovering from hip fracture surgery

Exclusion Criteria:
- Cognitive impairment
- Less than moderate level of activities of daily living
- History of neurosurgery/significant head trauma
- Acutely unwell/moribund
- Presence of neurological diseases including overt stroke, dementia, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, intracranial tumours and other significant neurologic disorders.
- Postural or movement disorders likely to impede MRI scan
- Contraindications to MRI
- Complex fractures/multiple injuries
